title: 移居加拿大同伴集合區

replies.msg:
咁多位巴打，我第一次開post，如果有咩做錯講錯，請多多見諒。

我見近排多咗巴打對移居加拿大有興趣 (當然我都一樣 ，冇BNO，打算靠加拿大) 。有部分巴打對到加拿大生活感到不安，一黎對加拿大各樣野唔熟悉，二黎擔心財政狀況，最後就係有D巴打會孤身一人出發，一個人闖盪異地，更加不安 (其實個個係我)。

有見及此，我打算開個post，等想去加拿大讀書/搵工既巴打，係度搵同伴 (類似動畫入面異世界既公會 ) ，一齊去面對新既旅途。

介紹自己先，我已經20尾，儲咗筆錢，就算冇工開，慳住用應該夠係加拿大生活1-2年。冇咩特別專業 ，想去加拿大英語地區(法語區盡量唔去了，唔識法文)，去加拿大咩工都可以試下，肯請我又支持到生活就得。

提提大家，網上交友要帶眼識人。請小心保護個人資料，以免私隱外泄。

最後，歡迎大家入黎討論

+1 考慮緊
但係對加拿大認識唔多

quote.msg:

replies.msg:
我都係，對加拿大零認識。呢幾日睇緊加拿大最低工資，睇下求職網，又睇下每個月既開支(租屋、食、交通個D資料)，計下自己積蓄可以係加拿大捱幾耐。知道自己財政狀況有助安撫不安既情緒。

加拿大學費好貴 ，想讀但係驚一野用晒d錢

咁多位巴打，我第一次開post，如果有咩做錯講錯，請多多見諒。

我見近排多咗巴打對移居加拿大有興趣 (當然我都一樣 ，冇BNO，打算靠加拿大) 。有部分巴打對到加拿大生活感到不安，一黎對加拿大各樣野唔熟悉，二黎擔心財政狀況，最後就係有D巴打會孤身一人出發，一個人闖盪異地，更加不安 (其實個個係我)。

有見及此，我打算開個post，等想去加拿大讀書/搵工既巴打，係度搵同伴 (類似動畫入面異世界既公會 ) ，一齊去面對新既旅途。

介紹自己先，我已經20尾，儲咗筆錢，就算冇工開，慳住用應該夠係加拿大生活1-2年。冇咩特別專業 ，想去加拿大英語地區(法語區盡量唔去了，唔識法文)，去加拿大咩工都可以試下，肯請我又支持到生活就得。

最後，歡迎大家入黎討論

我見近排多咗巴打對移居加拿大有興趣 (當然我都一樣 ，冇BNO，打算靠加拿大) 。有部分巴打對到加拿大生活感到不安，一黎對加拿大各樣野唔熟悉，二黎擔心財政狀況，最後就係有D巴打會孤身一人出發，一個人闖盪異地，更加不安 (其實個個係我)。

有見及此，我打算開個post，等想去加拿大讀書/搵工既巴打，係度搵同伴 (類似動畫入面異世界既公會 ) ，一齊去面對新既旅途。

介紹自己先，我已經20尾，儲咗筆錢，就算冇工開，慳住用應該夠係加拿大生活1-2年。冇咩特別專業 ，想去加拿大英語地區(法語區盡量唔去了，唔識法文)，去加拿大咩工都可以試下，肯請我又支持到生活就得。

提提大家，網上交友要帶眼識人。請小心保護個人資料，以免私隱外泄。

最後，歡迎大家入黎討論
做緊IT相關行業，其實最終目標想去美帝做野，趁有機會去加拿大落腳做住幾年先有冇得諗？
TN Visas after citizenship!

2個人:

A series of earthquakes have struck off the coast of B.C. since Wednesday and a major earthquake shook Southern California on Thursday, reminding West Coast residents of the years-long fear that the Pacific Northwest is due for a “Big One.”

For years, experts have warned that the region is due for a major earthquake, potentially reaching a magnitude of 9.0, killing thousands and causing waves up to 20 metres high.

“If we look back earlier in history, they were more frequent. We had something of the order of 10 or 11 prior to that, in the period that we’ve had seismometers installed,” explained John Clague, an environmental sciences expert with Simon Fraser University

I was thinking of moving to Vancouver 40 years ago..
I decided to stay in Toronto after someone moved from B.C. told me about the "Big One"....

A series of earthquakes have struck off the coast of B.C. since Wednesday and a major earthquake shook Southern California on Thursday, reminding West Coast residents of the years-long fear that the Pacific Northwest is due for a “Big One.”

For years, experts have warned that the region is due for a major earthquake, potentially reaching a magnitude of 9.0, killing thousands and causing waves up to 20 metres high.

“If we look back earlier in history, they were more frequent. We had something of the order of 10 or 11 prior to that, in the period that we’ve had seismometers installed,” explained John Clague, an environmental sciences expert with Simon Fraser University

2個人:
多倫多dt shareroom 800~1200cad (全包)，再睇下邊度搵到工，之後再搬
食: 600cad 三餐自己煮
電話費 80 cad per head, 160cad for two
交通: 188 per head (12 months TCC pass), 376 for two
雜費: 500 cad (唔知會唔會有突發野)

I was a vice President of a liberal riding association 40 years ago.
i think the two major parties liberals and conservatives are pretty similar.
NDP is a bit left but mostly middle. A former premier of Ontario (Bob Rae) joined the Liberal party and because an interim leader before the current asshole became the Liberal leader and now Prime Minister

All political parties want to attract votes. Each party targets people who share their views/policies etc. They each have their core supporters.
Most elections are decided by how well each party can maintain their core vote plus voters with no affiliations (swing votes).

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_Canada
There are parties that has a very specific agenda- Green Party and
Bloc Québécois. there used to be a party called Social credit but did not see them lately..

咁多位巴打，我第一次開post，如果有咩做錯講錯，請多多見諒。

我見近排多咗巴打對移居加拿大有興趣 (當然我都一樣 ，冇BNO，打算靠加拿大) 。有部分巴打對到加拿大生活感到不安，一黎對加拿大各樣野唔熟悉，二黎擔心財政狀況，最後就係有D巴打會孤身一人出發，一個人闖盪異地，更加不安 (其實個個係我)。

有見及此，我打算開個post，等想去加拿大讀書/搵工既巴打，係度搵同伴 (類似動畫入面異世界既公會 ) ，一齊去面對新既旅途。

介紹自己先，我已經20尾，儲咗筆錢，就算冇工開，慳住用應該夠係加拿大生活1-2年。冇咩特別專業 ，想去加拿大英語地區(法語區盡量唔去了，唔識法文)，去加拿大咩工都可以試下，肯請我又支持到生活就得。

提提大家，網上交友要帶眼識人。請小心保護個人資料，以免私隱外泄。

最後，歡迎大家入黎討論
做緊IT相關行業，其實最終目標想去美帝做野，趁有機會去加拿大落腳做住幾年先有冇得諗？

我就黎成30年都係香港，唔清楚。 不負責任既答法就係去咗加拿大先，起碼叫英語國家，拎返英語國家既職場經驗，之後再搵機會去美國。可能你係加拿大慣咗，唔想走呢。

負責任既答法係，建議巴打搵多d資料再決定，有其他巴打熟悉情況既話，請幫幫手

考左 G1 你必須要等至少 8-12個月先可以報 G2，pass 左 G2 之後，你要等至少一年先可以報G。

你問如果我本身係香港有國際牌又點睇？
香港同加拿大本身無 driver license exchange agreement，所以唔可以直接換。
你要做既係報考 G1, 然後交幾張document prove 你既 driving experience 。pass 左可以直接考 G, 中間唔需要等候期，你pass 左G 我就恭喜你。但如果你 fail 左，你就要重新考返G2, 然後十二個月後先可以考G。

My wife and I both have CA and CPA from USA. She has her own firm and I worked for the Govt. My salary were less than the taxes she paid.
My salary was below the median salary survey for CA with my experience in my Province. (lower by about 33%)

However, I have health benefits and pension. I have retired 4 years now and my pension is about 70% of my highest 5 years salary. (after adjusting for CPP and Old Age Security)

replies.msg:
Let me tell my own experience.
I studies Japanese since I was 9 years old. I had a few Japanese kid friends whose parents worked at Japanese consulate office, bank's and trading companies etc. I was the youngest student ever graduated from the Japanese classes ran by the Japan Cultural office in HK.

I got an A (only A) in the HK Certificate Exam.

I won the travel scholarship in a Canada wide Japanese language competition organized by the Japanese Govt (External Affairs Dept) and was awarded an all expenses paid two week study tour to Japan. There were about 100 top students from various Country all over the World. HK 's winner was a student of my student but I was two years younger than him. He didn't believe me so he called his teacher from Tokyo to confirm. His teacher addressed me as "Sansei' (teacher) on the phone. I taught his teacher when he was in the graduating class and his teacher taught him "grammar" when his was in beginners class.

I was a Japanese language interpreter for a breach of contract case and that was the only time I made money with the language.

During my career as a tax auditor, I had 4 Japanese Corporations taxpayers. The tax manger or controllers I dealt with are either Japanese who can speak English or Canadian. I never bother to let them know I can speak Japanese. On two occasions, their boss (usually Japanese from Japan) was quite shocked when I thanked them in Japanese for their co-operation after I presented them with the adjustments.

Most Japanese I came across in Canada were 'second generation' who don't speak Japanese. Just like my son is CBC. they JBC.

Why did I study Japanese? Well, my kid friends were mostly Japanese and were new to HK. They went to "HK Japanese school in Causeway Bay and they didn't speak Chinese nor English and they only play with Japanese speaking kids. I was their only non Japanese friends. I was the designated interpreter when they run into "white kids" from England.

My Japanese teacher's brother was an engineer with a Japanese Appliance distributor in HK. He had an engineering degree from Tokyo U. He came to Canada and was fortunate to get a similar position at the same manufacturer. That was a very rare situation. He had to travel to Japanese a few times every for product/ quality control meeting.
My own experience- useless

quote.msg:
next to useless. but nothing is absolute.

my friend works for a software company in Waterloo whose product tracks Xerox copy billing. clients are law firms and large companies worldwide. he travels to Japan often. software customization also means they have a team of Japanese translators and interpreters here.

I once worked for a company in Toronto with Japanese clients. again we have staff who speak the language for business requirements, user interface design, etc. , in addition to other professional translators.

Let me tell my own experience.
I studies Japanese since I was 9 years old. I had a few Japanese kid friends whose parents worked at Japanese consulate office, bank's and trading companies etc. I was the youngest student ever graduated from the Japanese classes ran by the Japan Cultural office in HK.

I got an A (only A) in the HK Certificate Exam.

I won the travel scholarship in a Canada wide Japanese language competition organized by the Japanese Govt (External Affairs Dept) and was awarded an all expenses paid two week study tour to Japan. There were about 100 top students from various Country all over the World. HK 's winner was a student of my student but I was two years younger than him. He didn't believe me so he called his teacher from Tokyo to confirm. His teacher addressed me as "Sansei' (teacher) on the phone. I taught his teacher when he was in the graduating class and his teacher taught him "grammar" when his was in beginners class.

I was a Japanese language interpreter for a breach of contract case and that was the only time I made money with the language.

During my career as a tax auditor, I had 4 Japanese Corporations taxpayers. The tax manger or controllers I dealt with are either Japanese who can speak English or Canadian. I never bother to let them know I can speak Japanese. On two occasions, their boss (usually Japanese from Japan) was quite shocked when I thanked them in Japanese for their co-operation after I presented them with the adjustments.

Most Japanese I came across in Canada were 'second generation' who don't speak Japanese. Just like my son is CBC. they JBC.

Why did I study Japanese? Well, my kid friends were mostly Japanese and were new to HK. They went to "HK Japanese school in Causeway Bay and they didn't speak Chinese nor English and they only play with Japanese speaking kids. I was their only non Japanese friends. I was the designated interpreter when they run into "white kids" from England.

My Japanese teacher's brother was an engineer with a Japanese Appliance distributor in HK. He had an engineering degree from Tokyo U. He came to Canada and was fortunate to get a similar position at the same manufacturer. That was a very rare situation. He had to travel to Japanese a few times every for product/ quality control meeting.
My own experience- useless

thank you for sharing.

it simply meant you never needed a job that specifically required Japanese skills, other than the contact interpreter work.

I've encountered quite a few Japanese speaking Caucasians and Chinese working for Japanese businesses in Canada, mostly in tourism related jobs.

quote.msg:
咁多位巴打，我第一次開post，如果有咩做錯講錯，請多多見諒。

我見近排多咗巴打對移居加拿大有興趣 (當然我都一樣 ，冇BNO，打算靠加拿大) 。有部分巴打對到加拿大生活感到不安，一黎對加拿大各樣野唔熟悉，二黎擔心財政狀況，最後就係有D巴打會孤身一人出發，一個人闖盪異地，更加不安 (其實個個係我)。

有見及此，我打算開個post，等想去加拿大讀書/搵工既巴打，係度搵同伴 (類似動畫入面異世界既公會 ) ，一齊去面對新既旅途。

介紹自己先，我已經20尾，儲咗筆錢，就算冇工開，慳住用應該夠係加拿大生活1-2年。冇咩特別專業 ，想去加拿大英語地區(法語區盡量唔去了，唔識法文)，去加拿大咩工都可以試下，肯請我又支持到生活就得。

提提大家，網上交友要帶眼識人。請小心保護個人資料，以免私隱外泄。

最後，歡迎大家入黎討論

replies.msg:
加拿大移民部長門迪奇諾表示，五年內於加拿大認可教育機構或海外高等教育機構畢業的香港人，可以提供快速而開放的工作簽證。加拿大方面亦會加快審批流程，讓申請者的配偶、伴侶及子女來加拿大進行新生活。

除此之外，申請成為加拿大永久居民都有新的途徑。過去3年內於加拿大認可的教育機構就讀，在加拿大完成最後課程的香港居民；或在加拿大認可的教育機構畢業或海外研究生，並在過去5年曾在加拿大工作一年的香港居民皆可申請。

如果你地而家仲係香港既話
要去加拿大即係一定要去讀書先得？

加拿大移民部長門迪奇諾表示，五年內於加拿大認可教育機構或海外高等教育機構畢業的香港人，可以提供快速而開放的工作簽證。加拿大方面亦會加快審批流程，讓申請者的配偶、伴侶及子女來加拿大進行新生活。

除此之外，申請成為加拿大永久居民都有新的途徑。過去3年內於加拿大認可的教育機構就讀，在加拿大完成最後課程的香港居民；或在加拿大認可的教育機構畢業或海外研究生，並在過去5年曾在加拿大工作一年的香港居民皆可申請。

https://bc.ctvnews.ca/5-people-from-b-c-and-yukon-charged-in-immigration-fraud-investigation-cbsa-says-1.5206320

VANCOUVER -- Four residents of Richmond and a man from Yukon have been charged in a "large-scale alleged immigration fraud scheme," according to the Canada Border Services Agency.

Tzu Chun Joyce Chang, 49, Qiong Joan Gu, 66, Aillison Shaunt Liu, 31, and Shouzhi Stanley Guo, 38 - all of Richmond - are facing charges in the investigation, as is resident Ian David Young, a 59-year-old resident of Whitehorse, Yukon.

The CBSA began investigating the alleged fraud in 2015 after being notified of suspicious documents submitted to Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada in support of permanent residency applications, the agency said in a news release.

Related Stories
People still taking advantage of cross-border B.C. park to skip quarantine
CBSA now requiring employees to wear face masks on the job
Bear cub with 'no travel documents' caught trying to cross Canada-U.S. border
B.C. man fined $1,000 at border crossing, says he never left Canada
"On the surface, these appeared to be nomination certificates from the government of Yukon issued under the Yukon Business Nominee Program," the CBSA said in its release. "However, the government of Yukon confirmed these documents were non-genuine and had not been issued by their office."

None of the applications involving suspicious documents were approved, the agency said, meaning no one was able to immigrate to Canada as a result of the alleged fraud.

The charges the alleged fraudsters now face stem from violations of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and the Criminal Code allegedly committed between July 2013 and September 2016, the CBSA said.

Among those charges are:

Misrepresenting material facts in relation to permanent residency applications
Communicating false or misleading information with intent to induce immigration to Canada
Transferring, selling, or offering to sell forged documents or otherwise make them available
Fraud on the government
Causing or attempting to cause the use of forged documents
Fraud or attempted fraud over $5,000
All five are scheduled to appear in B.C. provincial court in Richmond on Dec. 23, the CBSA said, adding that Young is currently wanted Canada-wide
